dialogue: Good evening, I don’t mean to bother you, but I’m in the neighborhood looking for two young women from my church.
I’m sure it is, I’m just wondering if they happened to stop by?
I’m sorry to say you’re the first house call I’ve received all day.
But you had asked the church for more information. So I imagined, perhaps, they might have still come by.
No, is there another way I can help?
I did tell them not to bother you.
Should we call the police? I hope they’re not caught in the storm?
I’m sure they’re not far. I appreciate your time.
I’m so sorry, but I’d be remiss if I didn’t ask you one more question ...I wondered if you had received this booklet.
I have not, but I will give it a look-see.
